Articles.Content:
Hi Guys,

I think Subassemblies are a great help. But I'm either not using it correctly or I've found a bug. I'm putting whole rockets into subassemblies. Then I just build the probe/ship I want to throw into space and attach the rocket from the subassemblies. The problem is that subassemblies that have items (rocket firing, stages separating, things doing stuff etc) in stage-1, stage-2.. etc blends in with the stage items from my probe. This then causes all sorts of things to go wrong.

I would like that items that are in a stage from a subassemblies be added as separate stages below any that might be existing in the current project. Currently they are blended together. How can I do this now or how can I put this forward as a bug report / enhancement request?

Thanks
Always remember to check the staging before you launch
It supposedly helps if you add sufficient number of empty stages below your probe's stages before you attach the ship.

Most of the time, the staging will remain in the proper order. If it doesn't because of hos it was saved, be sure to rearrange the order in the VAB before launching. The entire rocket below the probe saves properly.

It supposedly helps if you add sufficient number of empty stages below your probe's stages before you attach the ship.

Thanks Kasuha, I tried this and it works.
